title: I/O Interfaces
subject: Computer Organization
theory:
How CPU talks to Device Registers. 
1. **Memory Mapped**: I/O addresses are part of RAM space. Used in ARM. 
2. **Isolated**: Separate address space. Specific instruction (`IN`, `OUT`). Used in x86.

interview_questions.question: Advantage of Memory Mapped I/O?
interview_questions.answer: Same instructions (MOV, ADD) work for I/O. Simpler coding.
